Package grafiosch.repository

Interface GTNetMessageJpaRepository

All Superinterfaces:
BaseRepositoryCustom<GTNetMessage>, org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<GTNetMessage,Integer>, GTNetMessageJpaRepositoryBase, GTNetMessageJpaRepositoryCustom, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<GTNetMessage,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListCrudRepository<GTNetMessage,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListPagingAndSortingRepository<GTNetMessage,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<GTNetMessage,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<GTNetMessage>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<GTNetMessage,Integer>, UpdateCreateJpaRepository<GTNetMessage>
public interface GTNetMessageJpaRepository extends GTNetMessageJpaRepositoryBase, GTNetMessageJpaRepositoryCustom, UpdateCreateJpaRepository<GTNetMessage>

  • Method Details

    • markAsRead

      @Modifying @Query("UPDATE GTNetMessage m SET m.hasBeenRead = true WHERE m.idGtNetMessage = ?1") int markAsRead(Integer idGtNetMessage)
      Marks a message as read by setting hasBeenRead to true.
      Parameters:
      idGtNetMessage - the ID of the message to mark as read
      Returns:
      number of rows updated (0 or 1)

    • findAllByOrderByIdGtNetAscTimestampDesc

      List<GTNetMessage> findAllByOrderByIdGtNetAscTimestampDesc()

    • findUnansweredRequests

      @Query(name="GTNetMessage.findUnansweredRequests", nativeQuery=true) List<Object[]> findUnansweredRequests(byte sendRecv, List<Byte> messageCodes)
      Finds unanswered request messages based on direction and message codes. Named query: GTNetMessage.findUnansweredRequests Returns Object[] with: [0] = id_gt_net (Integer), [1] = id_gt_net_message (Integer)
      Parameters:
      sendRecv - the direction of request messages (0=SEND for outgoing, 1=RECEIVED for incoming)
      messageCodes - list of message codes that require a response (_RR_ codes: 1, 10, 50)
      Returns:
      list of Object[] containing [id_gt_net, id_gt_net_message] for unanswered requests

    • findBySendRecvAndMessageCodeIn

      @Query("SELECT m FROM GTNetMessage m WHERE m.sendRecv = ?1 AND m.messageCode IN ?2") List<GTNetMessage> findBySendRecvAndMessageCodeIn(byte sendRecv, List<Byte> messageCodes)
      Finds messages by direction and message codes. Used for finding future-oriented broadcast messages.
      Parameters:
      sendRecv - the message direction (0=SEND, 1=RECEIVED)
      messageCodes - list of message codes to search for
      Returns:
      list of matching messages

    • findOpenDiscontinuedMessage

      @Query(name="GTNetMessage.findOpenDiscontinuedMessage", nativeQuery=true) Integer findOpenDiscontinuedMessage(byte sendMessageCode, byte discontinuedCode, byte cancelCode)
      Finds an open GT_NET_OPERATION_DISCONTINUED_ALL_C message if one exists. An 'open' message is one that: - Was sent by this instance (send_recv = 0) - Has message_code = 25 (GT_NET_OPERATION_DISCONTINUED_ALL_C) - Has closeStartDate in the future - Has not been cancelled (no message with message_code = 27 and id_original_message pointing to it) Named query: GTNetMessage.findOpenDiscontinuedMessage
      Parameters:
      sendMessageCode - the SEND direction value (0)
      discontinuedCode - the GT_NET_OPERATION_DISCONTINUED_ALL_C value (25)
      cancelCode - the GT_NET_OPERATION_DISCONTINUED_CANCEL_ALL_C value (27)
      Returns:
      the ID of the open discontinued message, or null if none exists

    • countMessagesGroupedByIdGtNet

      @Query("SELECT m.idGtNet, COUNT(m) FROM GTNetMessage m GROUP BY m.idGtNet") List<Object[]> countMessagesGroupedByIdGtNet()
      Counts messages grouped by idGtNet for lazy loading support. Returns list of Object[] where [0] = idGtNet (Integer), [1] = count (Long).
      Returns:
      list of [idGtNet, count] pairs

    • findByIdGtNetOrderByTimestampDesc

      List<GTNetMessage> findByIdGtNetOrderByTimestampDesc(Integer idGtNet)
      Finds all messages for a specific GTNet domain, ordered by timestamp descending. Used for lazy loading when a row is expanded in the UI.
      Parameters:
      idGtNet - the GTNet domain ID
      Returns:
      list of messages ordered by timestamp descending (newest first)

    • findByReplyTo

      List<GTNetMessage> findByReplyTo(Integer replyTo)
      Finds all messages that are replies to a given message. Used for cascade deletion of response messages when their parent request is deleted.
      Parameters:
      replyTo - the ID of the parent message
      Returns:
      list of response messages that reply to the specified message

    • deleteRepliesToOldMessages

      @Transactional @Modifying @Query(nativeQuery=true) int deleteRepliesToOldMessages(List<Byte> messageCodes, Date beforeDate)
      Deletes reply messages that reference old GTNet messages being deleted. Must be called BEFORE deleteOldMessagesByCodesAndDate to avoid FK constraint violations. Uses multi-table DELETE to cascade delete associated parameters from gt_net_message_param. Named query: GTNetMessage.deleteRepliesToOldMessages
      Parameters:
      messageCodes - list of parent message codes whose replies should be deleted
      beforeDate - delete replies to messages with timestamp before this date
      Returns:
      number of affected rows (may be greater than deleted messages due to params)

    • deleteOldMessagesByCodesAndDate

      @Transactional @Modifying @Query(nativeQuery=true) int deleteOldMessagesByCodesAndDate(List<Byte> messageCodes, Date beforeDate)
      Deletes old GTNet messages by message codes and timestamp threshold. Uses multi-table DELETE to cascade delete associated parameters from gt_net_message_param. IMPORTANT: Call deleteRepliesToOldMessages first to avoid FK constraint violations on reply_to. Named query: GTNetMessage.deleteOldMessagesByCodesAndDate
      Parameters:
      messageCodes - list of message codes to delete (e.g., 60, 61 for LastPrice, 80, 81 for HistoryPrice)
      beforeDate - delete messages with timestamp before this date
      Returns:
      number of affected rows (may be greater than deleted messages due to params)

    • countMessagesByIdGtNet

      default Map<Integer,Integer> countMessagesByIdGtNet()
      Converts the count query result to a Map for efficient lookup.
      Returns:
      Map with idGtNet as key and message count as value

    • findAdminMessagesByCodeAndVisibility

      @Query("SELECT m FROM GTNetMessage m WHERE m.messageCode = ?1 AND m.visibility = ?2 ORDER BY m.idGtNet ASC, m.timestamp DESC") List<GTNetMessage> findAdminMessagesByCodeAndVisibility(byte messageCode, byte visibility)
      Finds all admin messages (messageCode=30) with specific visibility, ordered by idGtNet and timestamp. Used for the admin messages tab to display messages filtered by visibility level.
      Parameters:
      messageCode - the message code (30 = GT_NET_ADMIN_MESSAGE_SEL_C)
      visibility - the visibility level (0 = ALL_USERS, 1 = ADMIN_ONLY)
      Returns:
      list of admin messages with the specified visibility, ordered by idGtNet ASC, timestamp DESC

    • findAdminMessagesByVisibility

      default List<GTNetMessage> findAdminMessagesByVisibility(byte visibility)
      Convenience method to find admin messages (messageCode=30) with specific visibility.
      Parameters:
      visibility - the visibility level (0 = ALL_USERS, 1 = ADMIN_ONLY)
      Returns:
      list of admin messages with the specified visibility

    • findAdminMessagesForAdmin

      @Query("SELECT m FROM GTNetMessage m WHERE m.messageCode = ?1 AND m.visibility IN (?2, ?3) ORDER BY m.idGtNet ASC, m.timestamp DESC") List<GTNetMessage> findAdminMessagesForAdmin(byte messageCode, byte allUsersVisibility, byte adminOnlyVisibility)
      Finds all admin messages (messageCode=30) for administrators (both ALL_USERS and ADMIN_ONLY visibility). Used for the admin messages tab when an admin user is viewing.
      Parameters:
      messageCode - the message code (30 = GT_NET_ADMIN_MESSAGE_SEL_C)
      allUsersVisibility - the ALL_USERS visibility value (0)
      adminOnlyVisibility - the ADMIN_ONLY visibility value (1)
      Returns:
      list of admin messages with either visibility, ordered by idGtNet ASC, timestamp DESC

    • findAdminMessagesForAdmin

      default List<GTNetMessage> findAdminMessagesForAdmin()
      Convenience method to find all admin messages (messageCode=30) for administrators using enum values.
      Returns:
      list of admin messages with ALL_USERS or ADMIN_ONLY visibility, ordered by idGtNet ASC, timestamp DESC

    • countAdminMessagesGroupedByIdGtNetAndVisibility

      @Query("SELECT m.idGtNet, COUNT(m) FROM GTNetMessage m WHERE m.messageCode = ?1 AND m.visibility = ?2 GROUP BY m.idGtNet") List<Object[]> countAdminMessagesGroupedByIdGtNetAndVisibility(byte messageCode, byte visibility)
      Counts admin messages (messageCode=30) grouped by idGtNet for a specific visibility level. Used for badge counts in the admin messages tab. Returns list of Object[] where [0] = idGtNet (Integer), [1] = count (Long).
      Parameters:
      messageCode - the message code (30 = GT_NET_ADMIN_MESSAGE_SEL_C)
      visibility - the visibility level (0 = ALL_USERS, 1 = ADMIN_ONLY)
      Returns:
      list of [idGtNet, count] pairs for admin messages with the specified visibility

    • countAdminMessagesByVisibility

      default Map<Integer,Integer> countAdminMessagesByVisibility(byte visibility)
      Converts the visibility-filtered count query result to a Map for efficient lookup.
      Parameters:
      visibility - the visibility level (0 = ALL_USERS, 1 = ADMIN_ONLY)
      Returns:
      Map with idGtNet as key and message count as value

    • countAdminMessagesGroupedByIdGtNetForAdmin

      @Query("SELECT m.idGtNet, COUNT(m) FROM GTNetMessage m WHERE m.messageCode = ?1 AND m.visibility IN (?2, ?3) GROUP BY m.idGtNet") List<Object[]> countAdminMessagesGroupedByIdGtNetForAdmin(byte messageCode, byte allUsersVisibility, byte adminOnlyVisibility)
      Counts admin messages (messageCode=30) grouped by idGtNet for administrators (both ALL_USERS and ADMIN_ONLY visibility). Returns list of Object[] where [0] = idGtNet (Integer), [1] = count (Long).
      Parameters:
      messageCode - the message code (30 = GT_NET_ADMIN_MESSAGE_SEL_C)
      allUsersVisibility - the ALL_USERS visibility value (0)
      adminOnlyVisibility - the ADMIN_ONLY visibility value (1)
      Returns:
      list of [idGtNet, count] pairs for admin messages with either visibility

    • countAdminMessagesForAdmin

      default Map<Integer,Integer> countAdminMessagesForAdmin()
      Convenience method to count admin messages (messageCode=30) for administrators using enum values.
      Returns:
      Map with idGtNet as key and message count as value

    • findByIdGtNetMessage

      GTNetMessage findByIdGtNetMessage(Integer idGtNetMessage)
      Finds a message by its ID. Used for visibility enforcement when saving replies.
      Parameters:
      idGtNetMessage - the message ID
      Returns:
      the message, or null if not found
